choices.B: The OS is reporting raw capacity
choices.D: There was old data previously stored on the drive
choices.C: The OS is reporting capacity using base 2 numbers

discussion.content: unformatted capacity is the key, the answer is D, if was formatted or new then answer would be C

This description is vague. It really depends on how "significantly" less it is.
From this key adjective word, I would prefer "D" as the correct answer
 cuz different based calculation should have few GB or less difference only or even no lost depends on the system.

questions.question_text: After installing a 1 TB hard drive, a technician notices the OS is reporting significantly less unformatted capacity than was expected. Which of the following is the root cause?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Directory server can't be right as it's used for authentication and access control. Database server is the one to manage a large set of structured data (25 million names and phone numbers), which needs to be efficiently queried and retrieved for both printed phone books and an online directory
The answer must be D. A database server is used to collect and maintain large amounts of information. A directory server is to maintain employee access to networked data.

comments.content: AD is not the most efficient way to store 25M names, addresses and phone numbers which in then exacerbated by the fact that practically none of those folks will be accessing the phone company's server which needs authentication and you are then slowing down the system since it has tens of millions of unnecessary records to sort and move. A database is the best way to store that information.

discussion.content: Telephony companies have telephone line servers which contain the active directory domain service. AD DS contain a database supported by LDAP to host domain users, groups, computers and even telephone numbers.
Why is the answer B and not D?

questions.question_text: A telephone company is responsible for maintaining a list of 25 million names and phone numbers for inclusion in printed phone books as well as in an inline phone directory accessible on the company's website. Which of the following types of servers would be MOST appropriate to store its information?
A systems administrator has performed a memory upgrade on a server. The server does not recognize the new memory. Which of the following is the MOST likely cause?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
I would think in case of CPU not supporting the upgrade there would be an error or a warning. I believe in this scenario the memory was installed incorrectly.

choices.C: The new memory was installed incorrectly
choices.A: The CPU does not support the upgraded amount of memory
choices.B: The HDD firmware needs to be updated

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The port can't be faulty if PC had no issue with its connection if I get the description right.
